resources.string: Request Password Generate from plus on menu
Currently no accounts.\nClick plus icon above to add accounts.
Click plus icon to add accounts
Enter first account on the right
No search items. May need to ask to prepare search db from account db in previous panel.
Accounts List, sorted by Open Date
Import Accounts from a prior export
Accounts are searched from a Search DB, which is copied from Accounts DB
Do you want to leave editing without applying changes.
Edits are applied to the account
Are you sure you want to setup new to add an account.
Do you want to leave app.
Do you want to leave editing without applying changes.
List Accounts, Search Accounts, Password Suggestions

Track your accounts with sorted lists, searches, edits, backup/restore data, and select a password from list of suggestions. 
To view list in a different order, click the filter icon for four different sorted orders. Use the search menu request to see only accounts with searched for corporation names. 
To view & edit account details, click on item. To delete, swipe account left or right. To add an account, click plus sign at lower right corner. 
One of the four ordered lists is a custom ordered list. Order is arranged by the user. This is a way to keep more important accounts to the top of the list. Rearrange items by a drag/drop of an item. This drag/drop feature is only available in the Custom Sort list. 
Hint: To drag/drop, press and hold momentarily until color is changed indicating drag is started, then drag to the new position. 
To backup or restore use the Backup/Restore from the menu. This backups data. If a backup exists from a previous backup, this can be used to restore. 
The file location is noted in the Backup/Restore menu item Filename. Use menu item 'Show Backup File' to view of this previously exported file. Use the menu item share to copy the exported file onto other systems. 
Password Suggestions menu list passwords. Request group of 10 passwords from the menu. Passwords are either 8 or 10 positions, depending on user request. These passwords have at least one number and one symbol. The letters of passwords are selected based on the location on keyboard. This assist by keying in password with only one hand. Although, numbers and symbols are at random. 
Add, edit, or rearrange the items of the list. Passwords do not attach to an account. Reason why is explained next. 

Private Account Passwords Secrecy 
Keeping passwords electronically, even if encrypted, may leave you open to have your credentials stolen. Having an electronic copy (from a file or the apps database) with the credentials of company, user name, and password would highly exposed your accounts to hackers. 
The data db contains accounts with account Id and account info. Use paper to record the db's account Id and password you assigned it. To add an account, add on the app, then take the auto-generated id and the newly selected password to write on the paper report. Later when an account it needed, couple account and password by doing a search on the app for the account. Use the account id to reference into paper report for the password. The account ids are incremented, therefore the paper report is added in order of the account id. 

Account Protection 
Export data db through 'Backup / Restore' menu item for Backup. This exported data file is a json file representation of accounts db. Use this for backup. To restore data onto the app db, select Menu item Restore to rebuild from a previously exported file. 
Recommend to share exported data file to Dropbox or Email. Copy onto a safe space, separate from the paper report. Note: Suggested passwords are not backed up. 

APP Security 
Apps are protected for access to external files. To grant permission, go to Settings for Apps. Select this app Accounts to give permission for storage.

For this security reason, the passwords are not saved on a file or database. This app keeps account information excluding passwords. Your action is to manually tie together using the account id from this app to the written list of account id and password value. 
Tip: Use the export as the backup of your app data. If app is uninstalled, import exported file. 
Passwords are generated with a capital letter, a number, and all letters are either from left or right-hand keyboard keys. 
Use the menu to add an account, see a account list, search accounts, generate passwords.

\n\nImportant note: Backup your data, by export to a file. This file goes to your storage. When you view this exported data, it shows where it is located. Also, it gives an option to send to email or dropbox. This accessed on Account List, then select at the bottom for a list, to request View Exported Accounts list Personally, I like to send to my dropbox. Just in case database was wiped out, Use this import to restore data. Make sure to keep it up-to-date.
Prior closed into this account Id
This account closed to another account Id
When items are found, either select search icon on keyboard or select one of the items from the dropdown list.
Warning: Reload Search Dictionary DB when account corp names are new, deleted, or changed.\nUse button below to rebuild search dictionary.
No suggested passwords. Request Add fro list below.
